How to Install unicode-screensaver on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • unicode-screensaver

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install unicode-screensaver on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing unicode-screensaver on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall unicode-screensaver in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install unicode-screensaver, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install unicode-screensaver Using apt

To install unicode-screensaver in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install unicode-screensaver using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install unicode-screensaver

The installation of unicode-screensaver might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install unicode-screensaver Using apt-get

To install unicode-screensaver using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install unicode-screensaver.

sudo apt-get -y install unicode-screensaver

Install unicode-screensaver Using Synaptic

To install unicode-screensaver using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install unicode-screensaver on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for unicode-screensaver. This will display the unicode-screensaver package in the package window, now to install unicode-screensaver, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the unicode-screensaver package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of unicode-screensaver.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install unicode-screensaver Using aptitude

To install unicode-screensaver on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of unicode-screensaver.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install unicode-screensaver using the command aptitude install unicode-screensaver.

sudo aptitude -y install unicode-screensaver

How to Upgrade unicode-screensaver on debian

If you want to upgrade the unicode-screensaver package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade unicode-screensaver using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade unicode-screensaver to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade unicode-screensaver.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade unicode-screensaver sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade unicode-screensaver

Upgrade unicode-screensaver using Aptitude

To upgrade unicode-screensaver using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade unicode-screensaver.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade unicode-screensaver

Upgrade unicode-screensaver using Synaptic

To upgrade unicode-screensaver using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for unicode-screensaver, now right-click unicode-screensaver, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade unicode-screensaver just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall unicode-screensaver on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall unicode-screensaver from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just unicode-screensaver, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove unicode-screensaver

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of unicode-screensaver

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of unicode-screensaver you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge unicode-screensaver

Remove unicode-screensaver using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall unicode-screensaver using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for unicode-screensaver, right-click the unicode-screensaver package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall unicode-screensaver click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install unicode-screensaver on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade unicode-screensaver using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of unicode-screensaver then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
